main event: On 2 September 1949, a civilian in Alexandria, Louisiana observed a bright, round object for approximately 5 seconds.
interesting points: The object was compared to the brilliance of the sun and seemed to shoot across the sky suddenly,No evidence of exhaust or sound was noted during the sighting,The observer reported the altitude of the object at approximately 30Â° from the horizon,Multiple people were reportedly engaged in observing the object, indicating possible corroboration from others, The report concludes by suggesting the object could have been an asteroid or meteor.
witness description: a civilian with no specific identifiers given in the report
